questions.question: How does LenDenClub improve users’ lives?
questions.answer: Connects individual borrowers and lenders via a safe digital platform, offering quick short-term credit for emergencies and attractive passive returns (~10–12% p.a.) for lenders while bypassing informal high-cost lenders. Borrowers see approvals within minutes to hours and lenders benefit from automated diversification and real-time tracking.

questions.question: What impact do customers report?
questions.answer: Users praise ‘polished support staff’ who guide them through the process, and many claim returns of 20%+ via manual lending.

questions.question: How to register (borrower or lender)?
questions.answer: Download the app (Android/iOS). Sign up using mobile number, complete KYC (PAN, Aadhaar), link bank account. Borrowers need to be aged 21–55, salaried/currently employed with clean credit and minimum net salary. Lenders must be adult Indian citizens or NRIs with NRO, valid KYC and Indian bank account.

questions.question: How to borrow via the app?
questions.answer: Apply for a loan (personal/merchant/medical) once registered. AI-powered KYC and credit check run instantly. Approval typically within minutes to 18 hours, with disbursal done in 2–4 business days. EMIs auto-debited, no prepayment penalty after 3 months.

questions.question: How to lend via the app?
questions.answer:
Two modes:
• Manual P2P Lending: select borrowers & terms (1–36 months), minimum ₹250 per borrower.
• Automated FMPP: fixed-tenure plans (1–5 years), minimum ₹10k, hyper-diversified (100+ borrowers), targeted 10–12% returns. Returns and principal credited T+1 post repayment.

questions.question: What fees and interest rates apply?
questions.answer: Borrower interest depends on credit profile (~18–28% p.a.); lenders with FMPP can earn around 10–12% p.a. Returns are variable and not guaranteed, unlike bank FDs.

questions.question: What are the risks?
questions.answer: Defaults (NPA ~2–6%) persist; FMPP uses hyper-diversification to minimise impact. Money is locked in for plan duration; no guarantee like bank deposit insurance.

questions.answer: 24/7 in-app and email support (cs@lendenclub.com / support@lendenclub.com). Users request better dashboards and borrower-tracking features.

questions.answer: RBI-registered NBFC-P2P; uses ICICI Trust escrow accounts and encrypted transactions. Recently held AI hackathons to improve credit models.

questions.question: क्या मैं monthly repayments वाले loan choose कर सकता हूँ?
questions.answer: जी हाँ! Loan filter में 'Repayment Frequency' पर क्लिक कर monthly चुनें। Monthly loans में interest rate थोड़ा कम होता है।

questions.question: Platform पर total कितना invest किया जा सकता है?
questions.answer: Maximum investment limit ₹50 लाख है। New investors के लिए ₹5–10 लाख तक recommend करते हैं।

questions.question: App में withdrawal section कहाँ है?
questions.answer: Home screen के right side पर wallet icon → ‘Withdrawals’। यहाँ daily expected payments 6:30 PM से दिखते हैं। आप ‘More’ → ‘Withdraw’ पर क्लिक कर withdrawal request place कर सकते हैं। :contentReference[oaicite:0]{index=0}

questions.question: किसी loan के default होने पर क्या होगा?
questions.answer: हमारी recovery team 15 दिनों में contact करती है। 90 दिनों के बाद borrower default माना जाता है, और recovery actions initiate होते हैं (reminders → certified agents → legal notice)। 30 दिनों में 90% cases में payment recover हो जाता है। :contentReference[oaicite:1]{index=1}

questions.question: Personal loans में default rate कितना है?
questions.answer: Personal loans का default rate लगभग 4% है, पर higher interest (22–24%) से portfolio का average return 14–17% रहता है।

questions.question: Quarterly payments कैसे काम करते हैं?
questions.answer: हर 3 महीने के अंत में आपको principal + interest का payment मिलेगा। App में calendar icon से payment dates check कर सकते हैं।

questions.question: क्या loan select करते समय credit score देख सकते हैं?
questions.answer: जी हाँ! Loan details में 'Borrower Profile' section में CIBIL score (अगर available हो) दिखाया जाता है।

questions.question: Merchant loan क्या होता है?
questions.answer: छोटे दुकानदारों को ₹50,000 तक का business loan दिया जाता है। सुरक्षा के लिए उनका GST/cash flow verify किया जाता है।

questions.question: Payment delay होने पर कौन contact करे?
questions.answer: हमारे relationship manager विवेक को कॉल करें (9XXXX‑XXXXX) या app में 'Support Ticket' खोलें।

questions.question: क्या weekend में customer support मिलता है?
questions.answer: हाँ, शनिवार‑रविवार सुबह 10 बजे से शाम 6 बजे तक। App में 'Help Center' से live chat भी available है।

questions.question: Portfolio diversification क्यों ज़रूरी है?
questions.answer: 100 loans में ₹1 लाख बाँटने से अगर 3‑4 default भी हो जाएँ, तो बाकी 96 loans के returns से loss cover हो जाता है।

questions.question: क्या investment के बाद loan change कर सकते हैं?
questions.answer: नहीं, एक बार invest करने के बाद loan नहीं बदल सकते। पर आप नए loans में अतिरिक्त invest कर सकते हैं।

questions.question: Statement कहाँ से डाउनलोड करें?
questions.answer: App के ‘Portfolio’ section → ‘Transaction History’ → ‘Export as PDF’। Monthly statements automatically आपके registered email पर भेज दिए जाते हैं।

questions.question: ब्याज़ का calculation कैसे होता है?
questions.answer: Daily interest = (Loan amount × Interest rate)/365। जैसे ₹1000 loan पर 24% सालाना = ≈₹0.65 रोज़ाना।

questions.question: क्या early loan closure पर penalty है?
questions.answer: नहीं, borrowers बिना penalty के कभी भी loan बंद कर सकते हैं। उन्हे outstanding principal + accrued interest वापस मिलेगा।

questions.question: Green flag borrower क्या होता है?
questions.answer: वे borrower जिन्होंने पहले 2+ loans समय पर चुकाए हों। इनका default chance 1% से भी कम होता है।

questions.question: क्या NPA होने पर tax benefit मिलता है?
questions.answer: जी हाँ, NPA losses को other investment gains के ख़िलाफ़ tax deduction में claim किया जा सकता है।

questions.question: App में repayment schedule कैसे देखें?
questions.answer: App खोले → 'Invested Loans' section → relevant loan select करें → 'Repayment Schedule' देखें। यहाँ हर EMI की expected date और amount दिखेगी।

questions.question: Referral program है क्या?
questions.answer: हाँ! दोस्तों को refer करने पर आपको उनके first investment का 0.5% bonus मिलता है। यह 'Invite Friends' section में मिलेगा।

questions.question: क्या loan tenure change कर सकते हैं?
questions.answer: नहीं, tenure fix होती है। लेकिन आप बाजार में उपलब्ध अलग-अलग tenures (3/6/12 माह) के loans में invest कर सकते हैं।

questions.question: KYC फिर से कब कराना पड़ता है?
questions.answer: हर 24 महीनों में KYC को update करना ज़रूरी है। App notification आने पर Profile → 'Re‑KYC' से कर सकते हैं।

questions.question: Payment failed दिख रहा है, क्या करूँ?
questions.answer: सबसे पहले bank app में sufficient balance चेक करें। फिर LenDenClub app → 'Transaction' section → failed transaction → 'Retry Payment' पर क्लिक करें।

questions.question: क्या joint account में invest कर सकते हैं?
questions.answer: हाँ! Profile → 'Bank Accounts' → joint account add करें। यह account कम से कम 2 signatories के साथ होना चाहिए।

questions.question: Loan listing कब update होती है?
questions.answer: नए loans सुबह 10 बजे सामने आते हैं। कुछ high‑demand loans 5–10 मिनट में पूरी तरह भर जाते हैं।

questions.question: क्या returns पर TDS कटता है?
questions.answer: हाँ, RBI guidelines के अनुसार 5% TDS कटता है। PAN linked account होने पर आप Form 26AS पर claim कर सकते हैं।

questions.question: Relationship manager कैसे assign होता है?
questions.answer: ₹2 लाख+ invest करने पर dedicated manager automatically assign हो जाता है, या आप ‘Support Ticket’ में request भी कर सकते हैं।

questions.question: क्या SIP की तरह auto‑invest कर सकते हैं?
questions.answer: जी हाँ! 'Auto‑Invest' feature में जाकर monthly amount, risk profile और preferred loan types select करें।

questions.question: Late payment पर क्या charges लगते हैं?
questions.answer: Borrowers पर 2% monthly penalty लगती है, जिसका 50% investors को मिलता है।

questions.question: क्या loan details verify कर सकते हैं?
questions.answer: हर loan के साथ borrower की Aadhaar, PAN, bank‑statement verify होने का green tick दिखता है।

questions.question: What is an NBFC-P2P?
questions.answer: A Non-Banking Financial Company - Peer to Peer Lending Platform (NBFC-P2P) is a non-banking institution that carries on the business of a Peer to Peer Lending Platform, acting as an intermediary providing online marketplace services to connect lenders and borrowers.

questions.question: What are the registration requirements for an NBFC-P2P?
questions.answer: To register as an NBFC-P2P, a company must have a net owned fund of at least ₹2 crore, be incorporated in India, have necessary technological and managerial resources, and submit a viable business plan along with other requirements specified by RBI.

questions.question: What are the key restrictions for NBFC-P2P platforms?
questions.answer: NBFC-P2Ps cannot: 1) Raise deposits, 2) Lend on their own, 3) Provide credit enhancement or guarantees, 4) Permit secured lending, 5) Hold lender/borrower funds on their balance sheet, 6) Cross-sell products except loan-specific insurance, or 7) Permit international fund flows.

questions.question: What are the exposure limits for lenders and borrowers?
questions.answer: 1) Aggregate lender exposure across all P2P platforms is capped at ₹50 lakh (with ₹10+ lakh requiring net-worth certification). 2) Aggregate borrower exposure is capped at ₹10 lakh across all P2Ps. 3) Single lender exposure to one borrower cannot exceed ₹50,000.

questions.question: How are funds transferred between participants?
questions.answer: Funds move through escrow accounts operated by bank-promoted trustees: 1) Lenders' funds go to Lenders' Escrow Account then to specific borrowers. 2) Borrower repayments go to Borrowers' Escrow Account then to specific lenders. Funds cannot remain in escrow for more than T+1 day.

questions.question: What transparency requirements apply to NBFC-P2Ps?
questions.answer: Platforms must disclose to lenders: borrower details (with consent), loan terms, likely returns, fees; to borrowers: lender amount/rate offers; and publicly: credit assessment methodology, data usage policies, grievance redressal, portfolio performance including NPAs, and business model.

questions.question: What risk disclosures must be made to lenders?
questions.answer: Platforms must obtain explicit lender declarations acknowledging: 1) Understanding of all risks, 2) No assurance of principal/interest return, 3) Possibility of total principal loss in default, 4) Platform doesn't guarantee recovery, and 5) P2P lending isn't an investment product with assured returns.

questions.question: How does RBI ensure fair practices in recovery?
questions.answer: NBFC-P2Ps must: 1) Train staff to avoid harassment (no odd-hour calls/coercion), 2) Maintain participant confidentiality, 3) Periodically review Fair Practices Code compliance, and 4) Display caveats that RBI doesn't guarantee repayments.

questions.question: What are the IT and data security requirements?
questions.answer: Platforms must: 1) Store/process all data on India-located hardware, 2) Conduct biennial IS audits by CISA-certified auditors, 3) Have Board-approved Business Continuity Plans, and 4) Ensure loan agreements remain enforceable if platform ceases operations.

questions.question: What changes did RBI introduce in August 2024?
questions.answer: Key modifications include: 1) Stricter escrow rules (T+1 fund clearance), 2) Ban on credit enhancement practices, 3) No cross-selling except loan insurance, 4) Enhanced lender disclosures, 5) Clear platform identity display, and 6) Transparent fee structures.

questions.question: How does LenDenClub ensure borrower creditworthiness?
questions.answer: They: 1) Reject 95% of applicants, 2) Evaluate 600+ data points across 3 levels (system access, credit bureau, digital bank statements), 3) Use AI/ML for fraud checks, and 4) Focus on small, short-tenure loans (average ₹79k for 9 months merchant loans).

questions.question: What risk mitigation measures does LenDenClub employ?
questions.answer: 1) Hyper-diversification (₹1 lakh spread across thousands of borrowers), 2) Product diversification (retail/merchant loans), 3) Stringent credit assessment, and 4) Avoiding secondary sales/ALM mismatches by not offering liquid/short-term plans.

questions.question: How does Auto Lending work?
questions.answer: Lenders set criteria and sign an auto-debit mandate. EMIs received are directly deposited into lender accounts, then automatically redeployed per set criteria. LenDenClub reports average 11.23% XIRR on 12-month tenures.

questions.question: What is LenDenClub's historical performance?
questions.answer: As of Aug 2024: 1) Weighted average interest received: ~11.25%, 2) NPA rate: ~0.81%, 3) ₹14,594cr+ total disbursements, 4) Current AUM: ₹900cr, 5) 22 lakh investors, 80 lakh borrowers through 4,000+ channel partners.

questions.question: How to select a reliable P2P platform?
questions.answer: Check: 1) RBI registration (NBFC-P2P), 2) Promoter/management credentials, 3) Profitability and funding, 4) Years in operation (pre/post-regulation experience), 5) Volume handling capacity, 6) Product performance history, and 7) Compliance with RBI guidelines like no secondary sales.

questions.question: What are the key differences between P2P and Mutual Funds?
questions.answer: 1) Regulator: RBI vs SEBI, 2) Structure: Platform vs AMC, 3) Fund Use: Borrowers vs Companies, 4) Income Source: Fees only for both, 5) Risk: Credit risk (P2P) vs Market risk (MFs), 6) Diversification: Hyper-diversification in P2P vs sectoral in MFs.

questions.question: Where can I find LenDenClub's regulatory disclosures?
questions.answer: On their website/platform under: 1) 'About Us' showing RBI registration (Innofin Solutions Pvt Ltd), 2) Fair Practices Code, 3) Grievance Redressal details, and 4) Portfolio performance reports including NPA disclosures.

questions.question: What is LenDenClub's grievance redressal process?
questions.answer: 1) Complaints must be resolved within 1 month, 2) Platforms must display GRO contact details, 3) Unresolved complaints can be escalated to RBI's Customer Education Department, and 4) Covered under RBI's Integrated Ombudsman Scheme 2021.

questions.question: How does RBI supervise NBFC-P2Ps?
questions.answer: Through: 1) Regular inspections (started June 2023), 2) Quarterly reporting (loan disbursals/outstandings, escrow balances, complaints, leverage ratio), 3) Off-site monitoring, and 4) Power to cancel registration for non-compliance.

questions.question: What are the director eligibility requirements?
questions.answer: Directors must: 1) Meet 'fit and proper' criteria (verified via declarations/background checks), 2) Have relevant banking/NBFC experience, 3) Execute Deed of Covenants, and 4) Be vetted by Nomination Committees. At least one director must have banking/NBFC experience.

questions.question: What is the maximum loan tenure allowed on P2P platforms?
questions.answer: As per RBI guidelines, the maturity of loans facilitated through P2P platforms shall not exceed 36 months. This applies across all P2P lending platforms in India.

questions.question: How does LenDenClub handle borrower defaults?
questions.answer: LenDenClub follows a structured recovery process: 1) Initial reminders via calls/SMS, 2) After 30 days, intensified follow-ups, 3) Post 90 days, classified as NPA with legal notices sent, 4) Engagement with certified recovery agencies, while maintaining strict compliance with RBI's fair practices code for recovery.

questions.question: What are the key components of RBI's Fair Practices Code for P2P lending?
questions.answer: The code requires: 1) Clear risk disclosures to lenders, 2) Prohibition of harassment in recoveries, 3) Maintenance of participant confidentiality, 4) Board-approved grievance redressal mechanisms, 5) Periodic code compliance reviews, and 6) Prominent display of platform's NBFC-P2P registration status.

questions.question: How does LenDenClub's credit assessment process work?
questions.answer: LenDenClub uses a 3-level assessment: Level 1 - Digital footprint analysis (SMS/email parsing, geo-location, social media); Level 2 - Credit bureau checks (not just scores but full report analysis); Level 3 - Bank statement analysis (income verification, spending patterns). This rejects 95% of applicants automatically.

questions.question: What are the reporting requirements for NBFC-P2Ps to RBI?
questions.answer: Quarterly reporting includes: 1) Loan disbursals/closures/outstandings, 2) Lender/borrower counts, 3) Escrow account balances, 4) Complaint statistics, 5) Leverage ratio details. Additionally, annual IS audit reports and dividend declarations must be submitted.

questions.question: How does LenDenClub ensure diversification for lenders?
questions.answer: The platform automatically spreads each ₹1 lakh investment across 1,000+ borrowers (average ₹100/borrower). This hyper-diversification across products (personal/merchant loans), geographies, and tenures (3-36 months) mitigates concentration risk as per RBI's exposure limits.

questions.question: What are the corporate governance requirements for NBFC-P2Ps?
questions.answer: RBI mandates: 1) Board with at least one banking/NBFC-experienced director, 2) Risk Management Committee, 3) Fit-and-proper criteria for directors, 4) Deeds of Covenant for directors, 5) No outsourcing of core functions like internal audit/strategy, and 6) Annual director certifications.

questions.question: How does LenDenClub's Auto Lending feature comply with RBI's T+1 rule?
questions.answer: The Auto Lending system processes repayments through escrow within T+1 by: 1) Directly crediting EMIs to lender accounts, 2) Using auto-debit mandates for immediate reinvestment, 3) Maintaining separate lender/borrower escrow accounts as per RBI's Annex-I specifications, ensuring no fund parking.

questions.question: What are the restrictions on dividend payouts for NBFC-P2Ps?
questions.answer: RBI guidelines specify: 1) Maximum 50% payout ratio for compliant NBFC-P2Ps, 2) 10% cap if leverage ratio was breached in past 3 years, 3) No ceiling for platforms not accepting public funds, 4) Prior compliance with Section 45IC of RBI Act required, and 5) Board must consider audit qualifications/growth plans.

questions.question: How does LenDenClub's merchant loan product differ from personal loans?
questions.answer: Merchant loans (average ₹79k for 9 months) feature: 1) Business cash flow analysis, 2) Higher diversification (B2B), 3) Shorter tenure than RBI's 36-month cap, while personal loans (average ₹11k for 3 months) focus on: 1) Salary analysis, 2) Retail borrower profiles, 3) Ultra-short tenures.

questions.question: What are RBI's requirements for outsourcing by NBFC-P2Ps?
questions.answer: Key rules: 1) No outsourcing of core functions (audit/strategy), 2) Board-approved outsourcing policy, 3) Due diligence on service providers, 4) Contractual safeguards for data/confidentiality, 5) Right to audit service providers, 6) Business continuity plans, and 7) No outsourcing to director-related entities.

questions.question: How does LenDenClub's platform identity disclosure comply with RBI norms?
questions.answer: The platform: 1) Displays its registered name (Innofin Solutions Pvt Ltd) and NBFC-P2P license number, 2) Shows RBI disclaimer on all interfaces, 3) Maintains consistent branding as per RBI's 2024 guidelines, and 4) Avoids ambiguous representations about being a bank/deposit-taker.

questions.question: What are the technology requirements for P2P platforms?
questions.answer: RBI mandates: 1) Scalable IT infrastructure, 2) Data localization (India-based hardware), 3) Protection against unauthorized access, 4) Biennial IS audits by CISA auditors, 5) Adoption of ReBIT technical standards for account aggregation, and 6) Compliance with IT Governance Master Directions.

questions.question: How does LenDenClub's FMPP product work within RBI guidelines?
questions.answer: The Fixed Monthly Payment Plan: 1) Doesn't guarantee returns (disclaims credit risk), 2) Maintains lender control (no secondary market), 3) Uses hyper-diversification (95% loans <₹100), 4) Provides monthly payout visibility, and 5) Has maintained 10%+ historical XIRR without principal loss, as disclosed per RBI transparency norms.

questions.question: What are RBI's rules for foreign investment in NBFC-P2Ps?
questions.answer: 1) No fresh investment from FATF non-compliant jurisdictions, 2) Existing investors can continue but can't exceed 20% voting power, 3) Prior RBI approval needed for >26% ownership changes, 4) Declaration required that investors aren't associated with banned deposit-taking entities.

questions.question: How does LenDenClub ensure compliance with RBI's 'no credit enhancement' rule?
questions.answer: The platform: 1) Removed all return-boosting practices (like 120/115 schemes), 2) Added explicit risk warnings during onboarding, 3) Shows actual historical returns (not projections), 4) Doesn't offer liquidity options that imply guarantees, and 5) Maintains clear segregation between platform fees and lender returns.

questions.question: What are the business continuity requirements for P2P platforms?
questions.answer: RBI requires: 1) Board-approved continuity plans, 2) Safeguards for loan servicing during disruptions, 3) Third-party arrangements for contract administration if platform ceases operations, 4) Regular testing of recovery procedures, and 5) Hardware/software redundancy measures.

questions.question: How does LenDenClub's channel partner model operate?
questions.answer: The platform works with 4,000+ mutual fund distributors as partners who: 1) Source lenders/borrowers, 2) Operate under strict KYC/AML guidelines, 3) Earn commissions (not interest spreads), and 4) Use dedicated CP dashboards that comply with RBI's 'no closed user group' rule for matching.

questions.question: What are the KYC requirements for P2P participants?
questions.answer: Platforms must: 1) Perform full KYC for lenders/borrowers, 2) Obtain explicit consent for credit information access, 3) Re-KYC for expired documents, 4) Maintain records per PMLA rules, and 5) Ensure FATF compliance for cross-border transactions (though international flows are prohibited).

questions.question: How does LenDenClub's recovery fee structure work?
questions.answer: As disclosed in their Fees & Charges: 1) Only applied when third-party agencies are engaged (post 90-day default), 2) Percentage-based on recovered amount, 3) Fully transparent in loan agreements, and 4) Deducted from recovered amounts before remittance to lenders, as permitted under RBI's fair practices code.

questions.question: What are RBI's guidelines on P2P platform pricing models?
questions.answer: Platforms must: 1) Charge only fixed fees (not performance-based), 2) Disclose all fees upfront, 3) Not link fees to loan repayment performance, 4) Get Board approval for pricing policies, and 5) Ensure fees are reasonable relative to services provided.

questions.question: How does LenDenClub's data security framework comply with RBI norms?
questions.answer: The platform: 1) Stores all data on Indian servers, 2) Uses bank-grade encryption, 3) Limits data access to 'need-to-know' basis, 4) Conducts biannual penetration testing, 5) Maintains SOC2 compliance, and 6) Has incident response protocols for breaches as per RBI's IT directions.

questions.question: What are the consequences of non-compliance for NBFC-P2Ps?
questions.answer: RBI may: 1) Impose business restrictions, 2) Levy monetary penalties, 3) Cancel registration, 4) Order winding down of operations, 5) Bar directors from financial sector, and 6) Make findings public - as witnessed during 2023-24 supervisory actions against non-compliant platforms.

questions.question: How does LenDenClub assist lenders with tax documentation?
questions.answer: The platform provides: 1) Automated interest income statements (Form 16A equivalent), 2) Portfolio-wise tax reports, 3) Principal/interest breakup for each loan, and 4) NPA classification details - all generated from their RBI-compliant accounting systems.

questions.question: What are RBI's rules regarding P2P platform advertisements?
questions.answer: Advertisements must: 1) Clearly state NBFC-P2P registration, 2) Not compare returns with bank deposits, 3) Disclose risks prominently, 4) Avoid guaranteed return language, and 5) Include the standard RBI disclaimer about non-responsibility for repayments.

questions.question: How does LenDenClub's leadership structure meet RBI's fit-and-proper norms?
questions.answer: With co-founders Bhavin Patel (ex-NBFC consultant) and Dipesh Karki (award-winning technologist), plus 15+ senior hires with 20 years average experience, the team exceeds RBI's requirement for at least one banking/NBFC-experienced director and demonstrates strong governance capabilities.
